dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Jeff Bezos just sold another huge chunk of Amazon stock—over 530,000 shares at around $1,800 each.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Jeff Bezos just sold another huge chunk of Amazon stock-over five hundred thirty thousand shares at around one thousand, eight hundred dollars each.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to documents filed on Monday afternoon with the Securities and Exchange Commission, the worlds richest man sold over 530,000 shares of Amazon when the stock price was around $1,900 a share.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and that's on top of the $1.6 billion he cashed out in July, right? It's like, what's he doing with all that?

dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The sales on August 1 and 2 followed $1.4 billion (after-tax) worth of Amazon stock he sold in the final three days of July.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Well, the leading theory is that it's for Blue Origin, his space company. He mentioned back in 2017 that he funds it by selling Amazon shares.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, the leading theory is that it's for Blue Origin, his space company. He mentioned back in twenty seventeen that he funds it by selling Amazon shares.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The leading theory is that it is to fund Blue Origin, a space exploration company that Bezos founded in September 2000. Bezos told journalists at a space exploration conference in 2017 that he was funding Blue Origin by selling some of his Amazon shares.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Oh right, Blue Origin—he founded that back in 2002, didn't he? So this isn't exactly new behavior for him.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh right, Blue Origin-he founded that back in two thousand two, didn't he? So this isn't exactly new behavior for him.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The leading theory is that it is to fund Blue Origin, a space exploration company that Bezos founded in September 2000.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And with Amazon's stock closing at $1,765 on Monday, his net worth is still estimated at over $90 billion.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And with Amazon's stock closing at one thousand, seven hundred sixty five dollars on Monday, his net worth is still estimated at over ninety dollars billion.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: As the richest man on earth, Bezos is now worth an estimated $110.1 billion, using Mondays closing share price for Amazon. On Monday, the stock closed at $1,765 a share.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Which, you know, keeps him as the richest person on earth. But it's interesting that Amazon itself isn't commenting on the sales.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which, you know, keeps him as the richest person on earth. But it's interesting that Amazon itself isn't commenting on the sales.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: As the richest man on earth, Bezos is now worth an estimated $110.1 billion, using Mondays closing share price for Amazon. A spokesman for Amazon has not commented on the purpose for Bezos last stock sales.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, the spokesman stayed quiet, so we're just left with theories. But given his past statements, the Blue Origin angle makes a lot of sense.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, the spokesman stayed quiet, so we're just left with theories. But given his past statements, the Blue Origin angle makes a lot of sense.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: A spokesman for Amazon has not commented on the purpose for Bezos last stock sales.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: I mean, space exploration doesn't come cheap. Selling stock is probably the most straightforward way to fund those ambitions.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I mean, space exploration doesn't come cheap. Selling stock is probably the most straightforward way to fund those ambitions.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And honestly, with shares at that price, even selling a fraction gives him massive liquidity.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And honestly, with shares at that price, even selling a fraction gives him massive liquidity.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It's wild to think about moving that much money in just a few days. Over half a million shares…

dialogue_turns.text: Right? And the SEC filings show it was done pretty methodically too.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? And the S E C filings show it was done pretty methodically too.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Makes you wonder if we'll see more sales soon, you know, depending on how Blue Origin's projects are going.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Makes you wonder if we'll see more sales soon, you know, depending on how Blue Origin's projects are going.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. He's been pretty consistent about using his Amazon wealth to bankroll his space dreams.

HostB: Yeah, and that’s on top of the $1.6 billion he cashed out in July, right? It’s like, what’s he doing with all that?
HostA: Well, the leading theory is that it’s for Blue Origin, his space company. He mentioned back in 2017 that he funds it by selling Amazon shares.
HostB: Oh right, Blue Origin—he founded that back in 2002, didn’t he? So this isn’t exactly new behavior for him.
HostA: Exactly. And with Amazon’s stock closing at $1,765 on Monday, his net worth is still estimated at over $90 billion.
HostB: Which, you know, keeps him as the richest person on earth. But it’s interesting that Amazon itself isn’t commenting on the sales.
HostA: Yeah, the spokesman stayed quiet, so we’re just left with theories. But given his past statements, the Blue Origin angle makes a lot of sense.
HostB: I mean, space exploration doesn’t come cheap. Selling stock is probably the most straightforward way to fund those ambitions.
HostA: And honestly, with shares at that price, even selling a fraction gives him massive liquidity.
HostB: It’s wild to think about moving that much money in just a few days. Over half a million shares…
HostA: Right? And the SEC filings show it was done pretty methodically too.
HostB: Makes you wonder if we’ll see more sales soon, you know, depending on how Blue Origin’s projects are going.
HostA: For sure. He’s been pretty consistent about using his Amazon wealth to bankroll his space dreams.
